properties.areaDesc: South Washington Cascades; Northern Oregon Cascades
properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 6 at 8:43PM PST until February 8 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Portland OR
properties.description:
* WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8
inches possible between 2500 to 4000 feet. Total snow
accumulations of 8 to 16 inches possible above 4000 feet,
particularly Mt Hood northward. Winds could gust as high as 50
mph.

* WHERE...In Washington, South Washington Cascades. In Oregon,
Northern Oregon Cascades.

* WHEN...From late Friday afternoon through Saturday afternoon.

* IMPACTS...The abrupt drop in temperatures to well below freezing
Friday evening coupled with a period of intense snowfall will
likely produce hazardous travel conditions across the Cascades
Friday night into Saturday morning.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels will begin near 5000 feet late
Friday afternoon, but fall rapidly Friday evening to 2000 to
3000 feet. Snow levels will hover around 2000 feet Saturday.
properties.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON
